text: [MUSIC PLAYING]

HAIM MENDELSON: Would you build
a house without a blueprint?
I hope not.

A business model
is like a blueprint

for planning, building,
and evolving your business.

In this course,
we will learn what

makes the most successful
business models work

and how to apply those lessons
to design, or reinvent,
your own business models.

I am Professor Haim Mendelson
from the Stanford Graduate
School of Business.

And I've been
teaching for years how

to benefit from the
framework that you
will learn in this course.

Whether you are an executive
with an innovative idea

to transform your organization
or an entrepreneur

building your business
from the ground up,
this course is for you.

Our business model
architecture framework

will give you a proven
tool for turning
your vision into a reality.

We analyze companies such
as Tesla, Amazon, Moderna,

and Apple and hear from senior
executives at Google and Airbnb

how their companies have
reimagined their business

models to meet changing
customer needs.

MIN LIU: It is a bet that we're
taking between the short term
and the long term.

How do we create a truly
magical experience?
And we shoot for that.

HAIM MENDELSON: So, what is the
more general lesson from this?

JAMIE ROSENBERG: Open doors
for some of these conversations
with partners.

It was a difficult
task to get everyone

to buy into this concept
that didn't yet exist

but that we said would really
create a better future.

HAIM MENDELSON:
Digital technologies

accompanied by changes in
demographics, customer needs,

and supply chain structures
are disrupting and transforming

every industry in every
part of the world.

So, no matter who you are or
what company you work for,

sooner or later, you're going
to need a new business model.

I look forward to seeing you
in class at Stanford Online.
